Posts.Title: Please, Lord redwolf8812 GrammyR

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2014 03:39PM dreidteacher wrote: I sent my letter!  This is what I added, so I hope it helps. I have Stage III breast cancer, and the result of treatment (node removal and radiation) has left me with lymphedema in my left arm and hand. This is my dominant arm/hand so treatment is necessary every day. Lymphedema does not go away and there is no cure. I never knew about this horrible complication until it was confirmed by my oncologist. Please help as many suffer with lymphedema. I hope the Lymphedema Treatment Act passes. Cathy
Posts.Title: Lymphedema Treatment Act littlesista30 badger

They are not for me, but for the hospital staff that helps me. If they come in the room and helpful and nice they leave with treats. Think this will work? I'm not above a bribe at this stage. Hugs to all and a speedy recovery, Cathy
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 03:26PM dreidteacher wrote: I'm 58, married and have 2 adult sons. We have the 2 girls (2 large house dogs ) that still live at home with us. I was/am an elementary teacher, and retired 3 years ago I missed working with the children so returned to part time as soon as I retired. Several of my co-workers and friends are getting together on April 1st for my good-bye to the body part  dinner. We will probably make a few jokes in bad taste. I hope everyone had a good weekend considering the circumstances. My dh took me shopping today to get sports bras and a few button front pj's. Walmart has cheap bras and Macy's had there pj's half price so it wasn't  too bad. I guess I'll worry about my hair after surgery, but chemo starts soon after. What are your thoughts on lack of hair. I still teach kg - 5th grade English language learners part time so I don't want to scare them with on hair when I return.  Carabear and Lifelover, I see you all go before me so my good thoughts and prayers are being sent your way. I'll be watching for up-dates on you ladies. Gail your the day after me so I'll be thinking of you as well. Have a good week and lets laugh.
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2011 07:44PM dreidteacher wrote: rsummer, I'm sorry that I forgot to put in my previous post CONGRATULATIONS!, Now relax, rest, and stay painfree. Enjoy those little ones, too.
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 08:20PM dreidteacher wrote: Hi! I found out today my big date, I'm scheduled for April 7th for a bi-lateral mastectomy. I have Invasive Ductal Carcinoma   Stage II on left breast, Stage I on right breast ER+/PR+ HER2-, so .... bilateral mastectomy for me!.  I asked and will have the port put in at the same time so I don't have to have that done as a seperate surgery. Yes, chemo will be scheduled a couple of week after my surgery. I dread losing the eyebrows and lashes. I will wait to have reconstruction after because if I have to have radiation after chemo it may up the reconstruction. More tests will be done during surgery. They will also do gentic testing since my dad had cancer and I have it in 3 seperate areas and all three are different grades. Enough about me, I can't wait to get to know everyone here. Cathy
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Yes, chemo will be scheduled a couple of week after my surgery. I will wait to have reconstruction after because if I have to have radiation after chemo it messes up the reconstruction. Posts.Title: Had the core biospy yesterday dreidteacher shells43

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2015 03:02PM - edited Feb 7, 2015 05:15PM by dreidteacher I haven't been posting for a while. I found out I my breast cancer is back this Thursday. It changed it's spots so Tamoxifen was no help. Came back as triple negative metastatic breast cancer on chest wall, skin and hot spots in lymph below that area. I kind of shut down at that point when doctor was showing the pet scan. I get my port put back in on Tuesday and chemo Thursday on Gemzar and Carboplatin. It's a three week cycle. This is happening fast. I don't even remember what I packed to take to chemo. My doctor has me confused and I hope someone can explain. He said I was stage 3 tast time so I was still stage 3 but now with triple negative metastatic breast cancer. He also said I would always be in treatment. Am I stage 3? or 4? Also treatments would change over time. I don't know what to think as I guess I'm in shock as I had 3 years after TAC, rads, then Tamo. Any clarification would be appreciated. I pray for all of you, Cathy

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2012 06:36PM dreidteacher wrote: Binney you are right I need to keep practicing. The tricky things like to get out nd unroll while I'm wrapping. You wrap the other arm with your wrapped harn? You are gifted. I wish no one had to do this. My arm and hand looked better this morning, but by the time I got home from school and took off the sleeve and glove to massage and wrap it looked the worse it ever has. I will be not using the sleeve and glove this weekend. It will be a wrapped weekend for sure. Have a great weekend all. Cathy
Posts.Title: question about hand swelling dreidteacher jinky

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2012 09:32PM dreidteacher wrote: Kira, thank you for responding. My sleeve is custom, but the glove is not. The link gives great info and I think I have the right fit. Especially for the sleeve. The glove seems tight, but doesn't hurt. The swelling is bad above fingers in the palm of my hand. The wrapping last night brought it down but not what it had been. I will see my therapist Monday after school and until then keep it wrapped. It may be the glove but not sure as I'm new to this. I have an hours drive to were my therapist is located, but thankful I have one. Odd thing about this is in early December I took my wedding rings in to be sized as they were so loose they would come off. They sized me as a 51/2, but by the time they were ready I was swelling with the lymphedema. Now a 7 would be tight on a good day. Scared I will never be able to wear them again. Does it get better? I am sorry to whine as all of you have had to put up with this much longer. Again thank you as all of you are so knowledgeable. You are an awesome group and I'm thankful for your help. cathy
